name: Pumpkin Seed Butter Fettuccine with Spinach
description: For this no-cream, creamy pasta sauce we’ve used pumpkin seed butter, though other smooth seed or nut butters such as sunflower, cashew, hazelnut or almond butter work well, too. If you prefer a stuffed pasta, use a 250-g package of fresh or frozen ravioli instead of the fettuccine. Baby kale can sub in for the spinach for a sharper taste. This recipe can easily be doubled for four servings.
recipeIngredient: Salt6 oz (170 g) fettuccine or other long pasta 1 clove garlic, minced¼ cup (60 mL) pumpkin seed butter or other seed or nut butter¼ cup (60 mL) freshly grated Parmesan cheese Freshly ground pepper3 cups (750 mL) packed baby spinach, about 3 oz (85 g)½ cup (125 mL) grape tomatoes, halved Additional freshly grated Parmesan cheese Green pumpkin seeds
recipeInstructions: Bring a pot of salted water to a Cook pasta according to package directions just until al dente.
Meanwhile, combine garlic, seed butter, Parmesan and ¼ tsp (1 mL) pepper in a large, heatproof bowl.

Remove pasta from heat (but don’t drain it). Scoop out about ½ cup (125 mL) of the pasta cooking water and whisk into the seed butter mixture until blended. Add spinach, then use tongs or a strainer to remove pasta from pot (leaving water in the pot) and place on top of spinach. Let stand for 30 seconds to wilt spinach.

Toss pasta gently to coat, gradually adding more of the pasta cooking water, about another ½ cup (125 mL), to moisten as desired. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Arrange in warmed pasta bowls, top with grape tomatoes, more Parmesan and a sprinkle of pumpkin seeds.
